chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
f: R -> R
n: nat
x: R

Goal:
Derive_n (fun x : R => - f x) n x = - Derive_n f n x

Premises:
Derive_n = fix Derive_n (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R) {struct n} : R := match n with | 0%nat => f x | S n0 => Derive (Derive_n f n0) x end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope R_scope]
*** [ R : Set ]
Derive_n_ext_loc : forall (f g : R_UniformSpace -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_UniformSpace), locally x (fun t : R_UniformSpace => f t = g t) -> Derive_n f n x = Derive_n g n x
Derive_n_ext : forall (f g : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R), (forall t : R, f t = g t) -> Derive_n f n x = Derive_n g n x
Derive_n_comp : forall (f : R -> R) (n m : nat) (x : R), Derive_n (Derive_n f m) n x = Derive_n f (n + m) x
is_derive_n_unique : forall (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x l : R), is_derive_n f n x l -> Derive_n f n x = l
Derive_n_correct : forall (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_AbsRing), ex_derive_n f n x -> is_derive_n f n x (Derive_n f n x)
Derive_opp : forall (f : R -> R) (x : R), Derive (fun x0 : R => - f x0) x = - Derive f x
RiemannInt_opp : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (pr_f : Riemann_integrable f a b) (pr : Riemann_integrable (fun x : R => - f x) a b), RiemannInt pr = - RiemannInt pr_f
Derive_n_const : forall (n : nat) (a x : R), Derive_n (fun _ : R => a) (S n) x = 0
Derive = fun (f : R -> R) (x : R) => real (Lim (fun h : R => (f (x + h) - f x) / h) 0) : (R -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
is_derive_n = fun (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x l : R) => match n with | 0%nat => f x = l | S n0 => is_derive (Derive_n f n0) x l end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope R_scope R_scope]
RiemannInt_P10 : forall (f g : R -> R) (a b l : R), Riemann_integrable f a b -> Riemann_integrable g a b -> Riemann_integrable (fun x : R => f x + l * g x) a b
opp_fct = fun (f : R -> R) (x : R) => - f x : (R -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope]
derive_pt_opp : forall (f : R -> R) (x : R) (pr1 : derivable_pt f x), derive_pt (- f) x (derivable_pt_opp f x pr1) = - derive_pt f x pr1
RiemannInt_P13 : forall (f g : R -> R) (a b l : R) (pr1 : Riemann_integrable f a b) (pr2 : Riemann_integrable g a b) (pr3 : Riemann_integrable (fun x : R => f x + l * g x) a b), RiemannInt pr3 = RiemannInt pr1 + l * RiemannInt pr2
filter_forall : forall P : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x) -> ?F P where ?T : [f : R -> R n : nat x : R |- Type] ?F : [f : R -> R n : nat x : R |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [f : R -> R n : nat x : R |- Filter ?F]
filter_imp : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x -> Q x) -> ?F P -> ?F Q where ?T : [f : R -> R n : nat x : R |- Type] ?F : [f : R -> R n : nat x : R |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [f : R -> R n : nat x : R |- Filter ?F]
IZR = fun z : Z => match z with | 0%Z => R0 | Z.pos n => IPR n | Z.neg n => - IPR n end : Z -> R Argument scope is [Z_scope]
Ratan_seq_opp : forall (x : R) (n : nat), Ratan_seq (- x) n = - Ratan_seq x n
Lim_seq_opp : forall u : nat -> R, Lim_seq (fun n : nat => - u n) = Rbar_opp (Lim_seq u)
f_equal_R : forall (B : Type) (f : R -> B) (x y : R), x = y -> f x = f y
Derive_ext_loc : forall (f g : R_UniformSpace -> R) (x : R_UniformSpace), locally x (fun t : R_UniformSpace => f t = g t) -> Derive f x = Derive g x
ex_derive_n = fun (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_AbsRing) => match n with | 0%nat => True | S n0 => ex_derive (Derive_n f n0) x end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R_AbsRing -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope _]
derive_pt_eq_0 : forall (f : R -> R) (x l : R) (pr : derivable_pt f x), derivable_pt_lim f x l -> derive_pt f x pr = l
locally_locally : forall (x0 : ?T) (P : ?T -> Prop), locally x0 P -> locally x0 (fun y : ?T => locally y P) where ?T : [f : R -> R n : nat x : R |- UniformSpace]
Derive_ext : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : R), (forall t : R, f t = g t) -> Derive f x = Derive g x
RiemannInt_ext : forall (f g : R -> R) (a b : R) (pr_f : Riemann_integrable f a b) (pr_g : Riemann_integrable g a b), (forall x : R, Rmin a b <= x <= Rmax a b -> f x = g x) -> RiemannInt pr_f = RiemannInt pr_g
Ratan_seq = fun (x : R) (n : nat) => x ^ (2 * n + 1) / INR (2 * n + 1) : R -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope nat_scope]
derivable_pt = fun (f : R -> R) (x : R) => {l : R | derivable_pt_abs f x l} : (R -> R) -> R -> Set Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope]
derivable_pt_abs = fun (f : R -> R) (x l : R) => derivable_pt_lim f x l : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope R_scope]
Derive_correct : forall (f : R_AbsRing -> R_NormedModule) (x : R_AbsRing), ex_derive f x -> is_derive f x (Derive f x)
